Specific Details: Shannon Chamber CEO Helen Downes was invited to present to Shannon Municipal District in Shannon Town Hall on Tuesday, 8 May. Discussion centred on matters of concern to Elected members in Shannon - retail, Shannon Airport, investment, rates, flood defences and a general overview of Shannon Chamber activities. This was the first such presentation by Shannon Chamber to Shannon Municial District.
DPOs Lobbied: Mike McKee|Councillor|Clare County Council::Gerry Flynn|Councillor|Clare County Council::P.J. Ryan|Councillor|Clare County Council::Cathal Crowe|Councillor|Clare County Council::John Crowe|Councillor|Clare County Council::Pat McMahon|Councillor|Clare County Council::Liam Conneally|Director of Services or Equivalent|Clare County Council
Subject Matter: Shannon Chamber CEO Helen Downes was invited to present to Shannon Municipal District in Shannon Town Hall on Tuesday, 8 May. Discussion centred on matters of concern to Elected members in Shannon - retail, Shannon Airport, investment, rates, flood defences and a general overview of Shannon Chamber activities. This was the first such presentation by Shannon Chamber to Shannon Municial District.
Intended Results: This was an information presenation by Shannon Chamber and questions that followed from elected members were linked to the presentation made. There were no intended results other than giving the elected members an understanding of the work of Shannon Chamber and to encourage ongoing dialogue for the betterment of Shannon.
Lobbying Activities: DPOs attending the meeting are listed in Section 5 below.|Meeting|1

Specific Details: Clare PPN participated in the Stop Climate Chaos Mass Lobbying day which took place on December 7th and aimed to influence Clare TDs to push for Faster and Fairer Climate Action
DPOs Lobbied: Cathal Crowe|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Michael McNamara|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Joe Carey|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Violet Anne Wynne|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Clare PPN participated in the Stop Climate Chaos Mass Lobbying day which took place on December 7th and aimed to influence Clare TDs to push for Faster and Fairer Climate Action
Intended Results: 1. To alert Clare TDs to the fact that constituents in Clare are aware and engaged with National Climate Policy. 2. The key demand was for TDs to sign a letter, drafted by Stop Climate Chaos, and to send it to Micheál Martin, Leo Varadkar and Eamon Ryan. The letter highlights concrete steps the Government can immediately take to kickstart a decade of faster and fairer climate action, including closing the glaring loopholes in the Climate Action Bill and acting urgently to cut emissions in all se
Lobbying Activities:
Each of Clare's 4 TDs participated in a zoom meeting with constituents for the purposes of this lobbying

So 4 meetings 1 per TD|Virtual Meeting|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: William Hederman a staff member from Clare PPN organised our participation in this event. Please note that private individuals from County Clare Participated in the lobbying via zoom however they are not required to report on their lobbying and Clare PPN does not feel that we should name them in our report given our obligations to them under GDPR.
Grassroots directive: An invitation to them to participate in a zoom meeting with each TD elected in Clare for the purposes of encouraging faster and fairer climate action. The participants received a training session but not a particular script

Specific Details: Anti Poverty Strategy Project in Clare - Clare PP submitted a range of parliamentary questions through our county TDs seeking information to inform a report on poverty in County Clare

Subject Matter: Anti Poverty Strategy Project in Clare - Clare PP submitted a range of parliamentary questions through our county TDs seeking information to inform a report on poverty in County Clare
Intended Results: We intended to gather accurate verifiable data and answers from ministers on a range of issues relating to rural development and poverty in Clare::We intended to keep the TDs aware of our project in order that they could use our findings in their policy making work

Specific Details: Ennis Chamber made a submission re: Draft OREDP ll to Department of Environment, Climate and Communications, a copy of which was submitted in letter form to Minister Eamon Ryan TD and to Cathal Crowe TD and Joe Carey TD.
DPOs Lobbied: Eamon Ryan|Minister|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications::Cathal Crowe|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Joe Carey|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Ennis Chamber made a submission re: Draft OREDP ll to Department of Environment, Climate and Communications, a copy of which was submitted in letter form to Minister Eamon Ryan TD and to Cathal Crowe TD and Joe Carey TD.
Intended Results: Ennis Chamber submission focussed on the need to re-balance geographic areas of priority for development of Offshore Renewable Energy (ORE) and in particular we requested Government to reconsider priority/timeline of development of Offshore Floating Wind Energy off County Clare Coastline.
Lobbying Activities: Ennis Chamber prepared and completed a submission in response to public consultation process re: Draft OREDP (Offshore Renewable Energy Development Plan) Part ll. That submission was then forwarded in emailed letter format to Minister Eamon Ryan TD and to elected government party TDs representing County Clare, namely Cathal Crowe TD and Joe Carey TD. |Email|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Ennis Chamber President Sheila Lynch, and Ennis Chamber CEO Margaret O'Brien
